main event: A first lieutenant and his wife saw a pale blue, oval-shaped object traveling east in a straight line and fading out, while driving near a drive-in movie theater in Alamogordo, New Mexico on October 7, 1952.
interesting points: The object was seen through the windshield of the automobile.
The object traveled for about 4-5 seconds before fading out.
The observer could not estimate the actual size, distance, or altitude of the object, but felt it was a controlled, intelligently guided craft.
The observer initially thought it might be a planet like Venus, but quickly dismissed that idea.
The sighting was made with the naked eye, and both the observer and his wife noticed the object at the same time.
witnesses: a first lieutenant and his wife
